title: The Devil Wears Nada
synopsis: Marge poses for a calendar for charity, but she is soon the talk of the town after she reveals a little too much during her photo shoot. Meanwhile, Carl receives a promotion at the plant. He then promotes Homer to be his executive assistant and drives him up the wall with requests, including going to Paris.

title: Pranks and Greens
synopsis: Groundskeeper Willie tells Bart about Andy Hamilton, a former student who was an even better prankster than Bart is. Bart tracks down Andy, now 19 and still pulling pranks, and the two become quick friends.

title: Rednecks and Broomsticks
synopsis: After stumbling upon some teenage Wiccans, Lisa accepts an invitation to join their coven. Just before Lisa is inducted Chief Wiggum arrives and arrests the three teens on charges of witchcraft; Lisa becomes the chief witness in the trial. Meanwhile, Homer starts to hang out with his new pal Cletus Spuckler after discovering the slack-jawed yokel makes moonshine and becomes the local moonshine taste-tester.

title: O Brother, Where Bart Thou?
synopsis: When Lisa Simpson tells Bart Simpson that he'll never have the special bond that she has with Maggie Simpson because he doesn't have any brothers, he tries to get Homer Simpson and Marge Simpson to make him a baby brother, but when that doesn't work, he goes to the orphanage---where Charlie (orphan) follows him home.

title: Thursdays with Abie
synopsis: A Springfield Shopper reporter takes an interest in Grampa's stories, making him front-page news, which makes Homer jealous, until he discovers what the reporter has in store for the final column; Lisa loses the classroom stuffed lamb she was watching for Bart - down a sewer drain.

title: Once Upon a Time in Springfield
synopsis: Krusty is forced to add a female character named Princess Penelope to his show in order to attract more female viewers. She immediately overshadows Krusty as the ratings improve. Bart and Milhouse want to get the show back to the way it was, but the situation gets more complicated when Krusty and Penelope fall in love and decide to get married. Meanwhile, Homer, Lenny, and Carl consider working at a competing nuclear plant when Mr. Burns cuts off their daily doughnut service.

title: Million Dollar Maybe
synopsis: Homer skips a date with Marge so he can buy a lottery ticket; when he wins a million dollars, he fears Marge's reaction to having blown off the date for a chance at fortune and he keeps his winnings a secret while showering the family with anonymous gifts. Meanwhile, Lisa helps to keep the senior citizens at the Springfield Retirement Castle stimulated with some video games.

title: Boy Meets Curl
synopsis: After discovering their love of curling Marge and Homer try out for the Olympic team and actually make it to the 2010 Vancouver Games. Meanwhile, in Vancouver, Lisa develops an addiction to collecting Olympic pins.

title: The Color Yellow
synopsis: When researching her family tree for someone who isn't a total boob or criminal, Lisa finds the 1860 diary of Eliza Simpson, a young girl who was in the Underground Railroad and tried to help a slave escape to Canada, but a diary by one of Milhouse's ancestors casts doubt on just what Eliza accomplished.

title: Postcards From the Wedge
synopsis: When Homer receives a letter from Edna Krabappel saying that Bart is way behind in his studies, he tries to take a hard line with him, but Marge thinks he has too much work, so Bart finds a way to turn their difference of opinion into a full-blown fight, only for it to end up with the two of them deciding that they need to worry about themselves more than Bart - at least until Bart discovers that running trains on the old Springfield Subway is causing the school's structure to crumble.

title: Stealing First Base
synopsis: When Springfield Elementary's two fourth-grade classes have to share desks rather than pay for a substitute teacher, Bart falls for his new deskmate, but after he kisses her, she starts sending him mixed signals; Lisa gets advice on how to handle being a female overachiever...from Michelle Obama.

title: The Greatest Story Ever D'ohed
synopsis: "The Simpsons are going to..." Jerusalem, when Ned Flanders invites Homer along on a church retreat in an attempt to save his soul, but when Homer defiles one too many sacred sites, Ned says he's had enough.

title: American History X-cellent
synopsis: When stolen paintings are found in Burns Manor, Mr. Burns is arrested, so he has Waylon Smithers take over for him at the nuclear plant, but when he starts working the employees night and day, they try to get Mr. Burns back, even if it means breaking him out of prison - which it does; Bart and Lisa bond over one ant that survives an accident involving Lisa's ant farm.

title: Chief of Hearts
synopsis: Homer

title: The Squirt and the Whale
synopsis: Fed up with high electric bills, Homer puts up a windmill generator in the backyard. When he sees that the excess energy goes back to the power company, he takes the house off the power grid, making it entirely dependent on the windmill. Then a violent windstorm hits Springfield, and among the victims are the windmill and a whale which ends up beached, prompting Lisa, Homer, and many other townspeople to attempt to save it.

title: To Surveil With Love
synopsis: When Homer leaves a gym bag with radioactive waste (planted there by Waylon Smithers) unattended in a train station, Springfield has surveillance cameras installed throughout the town. But when citizen video monitor scanner Ned Flanders abuses his ability to speak through the cameras' speakers, Homer uses the camera blind spot Bart discovers to the town's advantage. Lisa, having heard one too many dumb blonde jokes, dyes her hair brown.

title: Moe Letter Blues
synopsis: Homer, Apu, and Reverend Lovejoy take a day trip with their kids on Mother's Day so their wives can have a day to themselves, but the three of them receive a message from Moe Szyslak saying that he's leaving Springfield...with one of their wives.

title: The Bob Next Door
synopsis:
"The Bob Next Door" is the twenty-second episode of Season 21. It originally aired on May 16, 2010. The episode was written by John Frink (writer) and directed by Nancy Kruse. Kelsey Grammer reprises his role as Sideshow Bob.


Bart becomes convinced that his new neighbor, Walt, is his arch enemy, Sideshow Bob, disguised and back for revenge. But when Marge tries to convince Bart otherwise by taking him to the state penitentiary, a disturbing truth is revealed, leading to danger for the spiky-haired boy.

title: Judge Me Tender
synopsis: American Idol host Ryan Seacrest and judges Simon Cowell, Randy Jackson, Kara DioGuardi, and Ellen DeGeneres welcome a new judge to the show - Moe, who displays an exceptional talent in judging things; while Moe is away, Homer has more time to spend at home with Marge... much to her dismay.

title: Elementary School Musical
synopsis: Marge sends Lisa to a performing arts camp where artsy counsellors (guest voices Jemaine Clement and Bret McKenzie of wikipedia:Flight of the Conchords) and fellow musically inclined campers (guest voices Lea Michele, Cory Monteith and Amber Riley from Glee) inspire her to embrace her creative side. After she returns to Springfield, Lisa becomes restless with her ho-hum suburban lifestyle and catches the first bus to Sprooklyn in hopes of reconnecting with her inner hipster. Meanwhile, Krusty get's tricked into the International Supreme Court for all the bad things he has done.

title: Loan-a Lisa
synopsis: When Grampa gives each member of the family a portion of his savings, Lisa invests in Nelson's brand-new business venture, but soon realizes that her friend's instant success might lure him away from the classroom. Worried that his judgment might be clouded, Lisa introduces Nelson to Facebook creator Mark Zuckerberg (character), only to find out that he too dropped out of school. But when Nelson's business suddenly takes a sharp turn, Lisa teaches her friend that education is invaluable.

title: MoneyBART
synopsis: In an effort to broaden her extracurricular horizons, Lisa decides to manage Bart's little league team. Using statistics and probabilities, Lisa leads the team to an incredible winning streak.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXI
synopsis: “Treehouse of Horror XXI” is the twenty-first Treehouse of Horror Series episode and the fourth episode of Season 22. It originally aired on November 7, 2010.

title: Lisa Simpson, This Isn't Your Life
synopsis: When Lisa Simpson finds out that Marge's good grades slipped away when she met Homer, she wants to avoid turning out like Marge. Meanwhile, Bart Simpson becomes the school bully.

title: The Fool Monty
synopsis: After Mr. Burns cuts in line for the medicine for a so-called disease called "House Cat Flu", everyone in town (Obviously except Smithers) starts hating him. Burns is informed by his doctor that he (Burns) will die in 5–6 weeks. Soon, Mr. Burns attempts to commit suicide but falls into a forest with Amnesia. Homer and Bart then set up a schedule for everyone in town to keep Burns for half an hour each and torture him.

title: How Munched Is That Birdie in the Window?
synopsis: A Pigeon crashed through Bart’s window, and he nurses it back to health, after Santa's Little Helper eats it, Bart has a hard time coping with the loss.

title: The Fight Before Christmas
synopsis: "The Fight Before Christmas" is the eighth episode of Season 22 and it aired on December 5, 2010.[1] This is a Christmas episode in the style of Simpson Christmas Stories.

title: Donnie Fatso
synopsis: Homer gets arrested and turns to the FBI to get out; to do that, he has to go undercover into Fat Tony’s mob.

title: Moms I'd Like to Forget
synopsis: “Moms I’d Like to Forget” is the tenth episode of Season 22 and aired on January 9, 2011.

title: Flaming Moe
synopsis: Smithers helps Moe turn his bar into a popular gay bar, but Smithers later gets mad at Moe for pretending to be gay. Meanwhile, Seymour Skinner develops a crush for the new music teacher—Calliope Juniper—so he talks Bart into going on a date with Ms. Juniper's daughter, Melody Juniper, with him and Calliope being chaperones.

title: Homer the Father
synopsis: Homer becomes addicted to an 80's family show and starts acting like the series' father. Bart wants a mini-bike and asks Homer for it, and it ends up as a reject. So Bart decides to sell SNPP secrets to China in exchange for the mini-bike.

title: The Blue and the Gray
synopsis: Marge discovers her natural grey hair, meanwhile, Homer becomes a Valentine's Day wingman to Moe, much to Marge's superstition that Homer is cheating on her.

title: Angry Dad: The Movie
synopsis: Angry Dad: The Movie is the fourteenth episode of Season 22. Bart makes a short film based off the character Angry Dad that he created in I Am Furious Yellow, that soon becomes successful that it gets nominated for several awards, but Homer is taking all the credit.

title: The Scorpion's Tale
synopsis: “The Scorpion’s Tale” is the fifteenth episode of Season 22.

title: A Midsummer's Nice Dream
synopsis: Springfield's favorite comedians Cheech Marlin (page does not exist) and Tommy Chong (page does not exist) break up as comedy partners. Homer becomes Cheech's new partner and Chong gets Skinner. Meanwhile, Lisa and Marge stops the Crazy Cat Lady's gibberish ways.

title: Love is a Many Strangled Thing
synopsis: At a parenting class, Homer confesses to strangling Bart and receives the ultimate punishment - a strangling by Kareem Abdul-Jabbar. Because of this, Homer becomes afraid of Bart at the fear of being killed by Abdul-Jabbar. So Marge has to find a way to set Homer straight.

title: The Great Simpsina
synopsis: Lisa ends up at the house of a famous magician titled "The Great Raymondo" who teaches her some of his magic tricks. But things go wrong when she gives away his greatest trick to his biggest rival - Cregg Demon.

title: The Real Housewives of Fat Tony
synopsis: Fat Tony falls in love with Selma and ends up proposing to "marry" her, but it's revealed that Fat Tony actually proposed "Gommar" to her and his real wife is somewhere else.

title: Homer Scissorhands
synopsis: Homer suddenly becomes a hair stylist after he beautifully cuts Patty Bouvier's hair. Meanwhile, Milhouse falls in love with a 5th grader after Lisa 'breaks up' with him.

title: 500 Keys
synopsis: 500 Keys is the twenty-first episode of Season 22. In it, Lisa discovers a hidden classroom under the school.

title: The Ned-liest Catch
synopsis: Edna Krabappel gets put in the Teacher Holding Facility for hurting Bart. When Bart helps Edna escape, Ned Flanders saves Edna from a falling ladder, and they begin dating.

title: The Falcon and the D'ohman
synopsis: Homer meets a new security guard at work who is a former CIA agent. This guard, Wayne, unfortunately gets fired for attacking Mr. Burns and a gang of Ukrainian mobster go to Springfield to kill Wayne. They kidnap Homer and it's up to Wayne to save him.

title: Bart Stops to Smell the Roosevelts
synopsis: Superintendent Chalmers is talked into educating Bart about Theodore Roosevelt, which turns out successful. Bart invites the bullies to his education, and they all like it; however, when Nelson's arms are fractured in a field trip to find Teddy Roosevelt's spectacles, Chalmers gets fired. The boys then take over the school, with all the kids in it, and agree to release it if Chalmers gets his job back.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXII
synopsis: "Treehouse of Horror XXII" is the third episode of Season 23 and the twenty-second Treehouse of Horror Series episode. It originally aired on October 30, 2011.

title: Replaceable You
synopsis: Bart and Martin invent a robot baby seal for a science fair. The plans turns into a success and the toy actually made Jasper and other senior citizens happy. However, the managers of some graveyards realize that a number of funerals are depleting and turn the seals evil. Meanwhile, Homer gets a new assistant, but he becomes her assistant when he ditches work so he can watch a comedy film with Barney.

title: The Food Wife
synopsis: Marge wants to be as fun as Homer so she, Bart and Lisa taste foreign food. They became foodies. They got an invitation to the famous restaurant in town but Marge didn't want to invite Homer and told him the wrong address.

title: The Book Job
synopsis: Homer want to prove Lisa is wrong that he cannot write a children fantasy so he make a team. Homer, Bart, Patty, Moe Szyslak, Seymour Skinner, Professor Frink and Neil Gaiman group author fantasy novel, while Lisa has plans for a single made novel, but she just can't think of one and be a fake author.

title: The Man in the Blue Flannel Pants
synopsis: "The Man in the Blue Flannel Pants" is the seventh episode of Season 23.

title: The Ten-Per-Cent Solution
synopsis: Krusty is down on his luck when the show gets cancelled and loses his talent agent. To help him, Simpson Family find a veteran agent, who happened to be his first, Annie Dubinsky (Joan Rivers). Despite their troubled past, Krusty gives Annie another chance. The move to bring the retro style helps revive his show. However, it has downside, Krusty must decide who should help him afterwards, his agent or the network.

title: Holidays of Future Passed
synopsis: "Holidays of Future Passed" is the ninth episode of Season 23. It originally aired on December 11, 2011. It was written by former Futurama writer J. Stewart Burns. (A flight for New New York can be seen in the episode.)

title: Politically Inept, with Homer Simpson
synopsis: At a flight, Homer starts complaining about modern flights while riding an aircraft food trolley, Bart records a video. This video goes viral and Homer creates a TV show. The show is a bit TOO good and Homer is chosen by the republicans to choose the presidential candidate running against Obama, and he quickly starts endorsing Ted Nugent

title: The D'oh-cial Network
synopsis: When Lisa and her family went to a new shopping mall, she met some of her friends, but they said that she was lame and very dorky. After realizing she has no friends, Lisa creates a social network site, Springface to gain their attention. However, the residents of Springfield soon become addicted to it, and later have car accidents and many injuries. Will Lisa escape this situation? Will she still have friends?

title: Moe Goes from Rags to Riches
synopsis: Moe's beloved bar rag, loomed as an ornate medieval tapestry, recounts its millennium-spanning life story. The tapestry was woven out of demon wool, so it could tell the future. It went from being a tapestry hung up in a building to a bar rag. And when the rag goes missing, the supposedly friendless Moe realizes that he has more friends than he thought, so Santa's little Helper gets the rag, and the rag says that it has never felt such love in its entire life. Meanwhile, Bart begs Milhouse for forgiveness after they get into a fight. Milhouse will only forgive him if he allow a tough man to punch him will Bart lose his fame and have to act like a loser.

title: The Daughter Also Rises
synopsis: Nick (The Daughter Also Rises), a seemingly gallant boy, becomes a potential love interest for Lisa.[1]

title: At Long Last Leave
synopsis: Everybody in Springfield (Except the Flanders) have had enough of the Simpsons' shenanigans, and decide to banish them from town. The family settle in a deranged town, where they pick up new skills like Maggie hunting with a crowbar. Lenny and Carl miss the family and decide to pay a visit. Soon, everybody in Springfield decides to rebuild Springfield where the Simpsons live now.

title: Exit Through the Kwik-E-Mart
synopsis: Bart plasters unflattering graffiti images of Homer all over Springfield. They catch the eyes of established street artists Shepard Fairey, Ron English, Kenny Scharf and Robbie Conal, who catch him in the act, and they invite him to exhibit his work at a gallery show of his own. Meanwhile, a new health-food superstore threatens to put the Kwik-E-Mart out of business.

title: How I Wet Your Mother
synopsis: Following a traumatic incident, Homer's bed-wetting problem worsens, and his family decide to infiltrate his dreams to get to its subconscious source. And in Homer's dreams is where his late mother Mona Simpson (voiced by Glenn Close) resides. This episode is a parody of the 2010 film Inception.

title: Them, Robot
synopsis: Mr. Burns replaces all of Springfield Power Plant's employees with Charles Montgomery Burns' robots but decides to keep Homer as the sole human worker. With unemployment at an all-time high and mechanical arms operating the workplace, Springfield becomes a dismal and humorless place. But when Homer's machine-programmed peers start to turn on the community and his former real-life employees come to the rescue, they all realize that robots can't replace human friends. This episode is a parody of the movie I, Robot.

title: Beware My Cheating Bart
synopsis: When Bart is forced to chaperone Jimbo's girlfriend, Shauna, to a movie after she turned down Milhouse, she ends up developing feelings for Bart, resulting in a whole bunch of trouble with the bullies at school. Meanwhile, Homer buys a new treadmill which comes with an online TV website and becomes hooked to the show "Stranded."

title: A Totally Fun Thing That Bart Will Never Do Again
synopsis: Bart Simpson, stuck in a rut, wants the family to go on a cruise. When they get aboard, they have a lot of fun, but Bart wants the fun to last longer.

title: The Spy Who Learned Me
synopsis: Homer Simpson and Marge Simpson go through marriage problems, and when Homer suffers a concussion at work and gets two months off, he imagines the crime fighter Stradivarius Cain (page does not exist), to help Homer be a better man. Meanwhile, Bart Simpson learns a way to stop Nelson stealing his lunch money - giving Nelson Muntz Krusty Burger until he's too fat to punch anyone.

title: Ned 'N Edna's Blend
synopsis: Ned and Edna announce that they secretly got hitched, so Marge throws a wedding party for them. But marriage invites trouble when Edna consults Bart. So she 'improves' Rods and Todds lives.

title: Lisa Goes Gaga
synopsis: "Lisa Goes Gaga" is the twenty-second episode of Season 23, and the season finale. Lady Gaga and Kevin Michael Richardson guest star.

title: Moonshine River
synopsis: After Bart realizes that his relationships didn't last long he decides to visit all of his ex-girlfriends for a second chance. After being rejected by them all he goes to see Mary Spuckler for him to learn that she ran away to New York. Finding Mary his last chance at love, the family travel to New York City.

title: Treehouse of Horror XXIII
synopsis:
For the continuing series of Halloween specials, see Treehouse of Horror Series.

“Now to get my comic book and explore a world where no one's mad at George Lucas.”
―Bart Simpson[src]

"Treehouse of Horror XXIII" is the second episode of Season 24. It originally aired on October 7, 2012.
“Now to get my comic book and explore a world where no one's mad at George Lucas.”

"Treehouse of Horror XXIII" is the second episode of Season 24. It originally aired on October 7, 2012.

"Treehouse of Horror XXIII" is the second episode of Season 24. It originally aired on October 7, 2012.
"Treehouse of Horror XXIII" is the second episode of Season 24. It originally aired on October 7, 2012.

title: Adventures in Baby-Getting
synopsis: "Adventures in Baby-Getting" is the third episode of Season 24, scheduled to air on October 21, 2012, but was pre-empted by Major League Baseball playoffs, and aired on November 4, 2012 instead. It featured guest star Jeff Gordon as himself.

title: Gone Abie Gone
synopsis: Homer puts Lisa's college fund into online banking as a way to fight back against big banks. Lisa becomes a gambler and soon rises her college fund with the help of Jennifer Tilly. Meanwhile, Grampa Simpson mysteriously disappears from the Springfield Retirement Castle, and leaves behind clues to parts of his life that the family never knew before, like the time he was married to a black singer named Rita LaFleur and when he owned a restaurant with Marvin Hamlisch.

title: Penny-Wiseguys
synopsis:

title: A Tree Grows in Springfield
synopsis: Homer wins a MyPad at the school auction and Steve Mobbs, who is now in heaven, talks to Homer through it. Homer goes into a funk when he breaks the myPad, until Ned Flanders discovers a miracle tree in the Simpsons' back garden. Everyone thought that a sign of hope will be at Evergreen Terrace but only one person, Kent Brockman, does not believe it. He investigates the sign of hope and saw that a person wrote the word hope with maple syrup.

title: The Day the Earth Stood Cool
synopsis: Please improve the article, or discuss the issue on the Talk:The Day the Earth Stood Cool (page does not exist).

title: To Cur With Love
synopsis: When fire at the retirement home forces Abraham Simpson to move home with the Simpsons, Homer throws out his back on moving day and decides to stay home to recover. While enjoying his time alone, Homer gets distracted by "Villageville" - a super-addictive tablet game in which he is able to create his own virtual village, but loses the family dog, Santa's Little Helper. When the family finds the dog, Grampa tells a story of Homer's former dog, Bongo (dog).

title: Homer Goes to Prep School
synopsis: Homer joins the "Springfield Preppers," an off-the-grid survivalist group whose leader (guest voice Tom Waits) has set up a top-secret retreat outside of town to prepare for the end of the world, but Marge Simpson grows skeptical of the group's alarmist shenanigans.

title: A Test Before Trying
synopsis: After Charles Montgomery Burns raises the rate for purchasing electricity from his power plant, most households and businesses can no longer afford to use any electrical appliances. Homer Simpson resorts to lugging a parking meter he found to different places in Springfield as a means of raising money.

title: Changing of the Guardian
synopsis: Danny DeVito as Herb Powell

title: Love is a Many Splintered Thing
synopsis:
Love is a Many Splintered Thing (RABF07) is the twelfth episode of Season 24 , which aired on February 10, 2013, as a Valentine's Day themed episode.
It guest starred Zooey Deschanel as Mary Spuckler, who has appeared in two episodes, including "Moonshine River" earlier in the season. Mary returns to Springfield to see Bart, but he doesn't pay her enough attention, which strains their relationship.
It also guest starred Benedict Cumberbatch, famous for playing Sherlock Holmes on the BBC's Sherlock, playing both a British Prime Minister and Severus Snape (page does not exist) from Harry Potter.[1] Previously the descriptions of the characters Cumberbatch was playing were described as a "sinister accountant" and a "snake-like character".
Political biographer Robert A. Caro and former Conan O'Brien bandleader Max Weinberg guest starred as themselves.

title: Hardly Kirk-ing
synopsis: "Hardly Kirk-ing" is the thirteenth episode of Season 24, aired on February 17, 2013.

title: Gorgeous Grampa
synopsis: The episode follows the family's discovery that Abraham Simpson used to be a Gorgeous George style wrestler. Bart Simpson also wants to take up wrestling, but Homer Simpson disapproves.

title: Black-eyed Please
synopsis: Flanders becomes jealous when his laid-back parents start to prefer Homer's company over his and he faces unbearable guilt after punching Homer in the eye, as he desperately tries to reconcile with him.

title: Dark Knight Court
synopsis: Springfield celebrates the resurrection of Jesus Christ in Easter. Dewey Largo conducts the school band but they blow Easter Eggs out of their instruments, landing on the crowd. After seeing Bart laughing, everyone chases after him. Mr. Burns and Smithers take a wander in the Android's Dungeon instead. Burns spots superhero comics and recalls his younger years of reading comic books but his father had burned down the comic book shop, locking everyone inside to teach Burns a lesson. Even the Simpsons family accuse their own son of the prank when he swears he didn't do it. Lisa protests for a trial but finds it difficult to find a judge that likes Bart. Grampa tells Lisa the story of him meeting Janet Reno near 1998, which Lisa refuses to believe.

title: What Animated Women Want
synopsis: Homer and Marge have organized a lunch date at the Swanky Fish. While there Marge is excited to be able to have 'grown up people' conversations as the kids aren't with them. When trying to spark conversation Homer doesn't seem interested and is only focused on eating the food. Enraged, she storms out of the restaurant and hails a taxi home. Worried about their marriage, Homer tries to fix his problems with Marge. He takes out a to-do list from within his wallet that Marge had given him. He finishes the list and shows Marge; she is disappointed in him because the list was from 6 years earlier. Homer returns to the Japanese restaurant they went to previously in the episode and is given relationship advice by the head chef. Homer takes some food from the restaurant back home and offers it to Marge; she is almost impressed but is again unhappy at him when Homer begins to eat the food himself. Unsure of what to do, Homer goes to Moe's Tavern and talks to Moe about his marriage problems. Moe suggests winning her back by exciting her with sex. As a result, Homer goes to the local sex shop where he purchases an array of different sex toys and machines. When he shows Marge all that he's bought she is confused and unimpressed. Homer sits down on one of the machines by mistake and is injured by it. He is taken to the hospital and while he is being treated they reconcile. Afterwards they return home and set all the sex items on fire and Marge admits that she was too hard on him as she says that no matter what he'll try to make things right.

title: Pulpit Friction
synopsis: Please improve the article, or discuss the issue on the Talk:Pulpit Friction (page does not exist).

title: Whiskey Business
synopsis: Please improve the article, or discuss the issue on the Talk:Whiskey Business (page does not exist).

title: The Fabulous Faker Boy
synopsis: Marge encourages Bart to explore his creative side and take music lessons and Bart develops a crush on his beautiful piano teacher, Zhenya. To pay for Bart's music lessons, Marge agrees to help Zhenya's father Slava (page does not exist) to drive so he can get his own driver's license. Meanwhile, Homer is shocked over that he lost the last two remaining hairs on his head and a co-worker portrayed by Patrick Stewart teaches Homer how to live with his newfound baldness. Justin Bieber tries to get into a talent show where Bart is playing piano and they won't admit him.[1]

title: The Saga of Carl
synopsis: Homer, Moe, Lenny and Carl win the Springfield Lottery, but when Carl takes off to Iceland – his homeland – with all the winnings, the guys embark on a Nordic adventure to rescue the cash.[1]

title: Dangers on a Train
synopsis: Dangers on a Train is the Season 24 finale episode of The Simpsons. Marge Simpson stumbles upon a website for married women to arrange affairs (after mistaking it for a website dedicated to cupcakes) and meets a man named Ben (Seth MacFarlane), who falls for Marge after the two bond over a Downton Abbey-esque period drama. Meanwhile, Bart and Homer obtain a small-scale train from the closing Towne Centre at Springfield Glenne shopping center. Homer continue to build up the train. Plot It is Homer and Marge's anniversary and Homer remembers that their 1st anniversary was one of the happiest days they ever had, between a visit to an upscale outdoor mall, getting Ned Flanders to watch a hyperactive infant Bart, and a lovemaking session on the mall's mini-train (which was called "Li'l Lisa" and provided the name of our starfish-headed middle child). When Homer heads to the mall to plan another anniversary, he is stunned to see it is a nearly-deserted pit of failure, but he manages to save the small train and plans to fix it with the help of his bar buddies and Reverend Lovejoy. Meanwhile, Marge tries to order Homer a batch of Dolly Madison cupcakes but accidentally signs onto a site called "Sassy Madison" (a parody of Ashley Madison) that helps married people have affairs, and in the course of deleting many perverted e-mails she ends up talking to a likable guy named Ben (Seth MacFarlane). At first, she tries to tell him that she is not interested but ends up sharing a same passion for a series which is Upton Rectory; things aren't helped because Homer's efforts to hide his train project are alienating Marge. It's only until Homer's plans are finished that he and Marge are reconciled.
